alert.note: Alert for Western Arctic Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued January 29 at 12:30AM AKST until January 30 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills of 45 to 65 below zero. * WHERE...Western Arctic Coast. * WHEN...Until 6 AM AKST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The coldest wind chills will be near Point Lay through noon Monday. Winds chills will moderate slowly from Monday afternoon Through Tuesday as temperatures slowly rise.
info.instruction: A Wind Chill Warning means the combination of very cold air and sustained wind speeds of 15 mph or more will create dangerously low wind chill values. Frost bite can occur quickly and even hypothermia or death if precautions are not taken.
